meanings.definition: A strong desire to know or learn something.
meanings.sent1: Her curiosity about the stars led her to study astronomy.
meanings.sent2: Children often show curiosity by asking many questions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity about the new toy was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His curiosity was a key that unlocked the mysteries of the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent5: The detective's curiosity drove her to solve the case.

meanings.definition: A strange or unusual object or fact.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed many curiosities from around the world.
meanings.sent2: The old house was full of hidden curiosities waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent3: The curiosity of the talking parrot entertained the guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned shipwreck was a curiosity on the deserted island.
meanings.sent5: The magician's box held a curiosity that amazed the audience.
